data.title: Show beacons over shroud
data.body: Currently shroud covers beacons. But they can be placed on shroud too. Spy plane for example.

data.title: Show an arrow at screen edge to indicate beacon direction
data.body:
Useful for locating a beacon, especially when there's no radar.

data.title: Edge scrolling not disabled while dragging in map editor minimap
data.body:
In map editor, drag the viewport in minimap towards the right and top edge of the screen. Edge scrolling moves the screen even when mouse doesn't move. This doesn't happen in game.

data.title: Made projectile shadows heightmap-aware
data.body: Fixes projectile shadow position on higher terrain in TS.

data.title: Fix a divide by zero crash in TabCompletionLogic.
data.body: Repro case: type "/alld" into the chat, press tab, delete the last character, press tab again.

data.title: Added Tiberian Sun map Pit Or Plateau
data.body: This map is open and does not contain (vital) bridges. The layout is balanced and conservative. See http://ra2maps.zzattack.org/Tiberian%20Sun/Official%20Multiplayer/getmap.php?map=Pit+or+Plateau

data.title: Account for disabled shroud/fog in ShroudRenderer.
data.body: Fixes #8827.

data.title: Refactor UI to better support TS
data.body:
TS used cameo.pal for icons, but sidebar.pal for clock animation (gclock2.shp), and darken.shp to darken icons when that item currently wasn't buildable (build limit reached, something else in production etc.).

Our current setup is a mostly-hardcoded mess:
Taking `ProductionPaletteWidget` as primary example, `clock` animation name is hardcoded, sequence `idle` is hardcoded, and it's hardcoded to use the same palette as the icon of that actor (which can be problematic for modders that use multiple icon palettes).
`cantBuild` (equivalent of TS darken) is hardcoded to Animation `clock`, sequence `idle` and sequence frame index 0. 
And finally, `ShadowIndex: 255` doesn't seem to work on palettes, likely the same issue as #8596 (making TS' `darken.shp` unusable for its intended purpose).

data.title: Add support for TS ice tiles
data.body:
This should be relatively straightforward:
- Add a new `IceLayer` trait that lives on the world.
  - Contains a `CellLayer<int>` representing the ice "strength" at each tile.
  - Scans the map during load and populates the initial state based on the tiles on the map. 
  - Tiles that contain ice are replaced with the ice-growable water tile.
  - Artwork for each cell is picked based on the current cell strength and the neighboring state (very similar to `D2KResourceLayer`).
  - Include a method for reducing the strength at a given cell.  If strength falls below 0 then remove the custom terrain type from the cell (allowing it to revert to "water").
  - Grow the ice using similar logic to our resource spawners: Every [configurable interval] increase the strength of [one or more] ice cell(s) that are either adjacent to another ice tile or adjacent to the shore.
- Add a new `DamagesIce` trait that lives on actors.
  - Each tick, check if the actor is on an ice tile.  If it is, reduce its strength.  If the the actor is no longer allowed in the cell after the damage is applied (i.e. it has broken the tile, but decoupled using the existing plumbing provided by terrain types and `Mobile`) then kill it with a special warhead that includes a damage type that triggers the spash death effect.
- Add a new `DamagesIce` warhead type.
  - This reduces strength of any ice tiles in the damage area.

data.title: Support high bridges in TS
data.body:
These are trickier than ground-level bridges because they exist in their own movement layer and allow units to go both over and under them (but not drive off the sides).

They share some similarities with tunnels [#6410], but are more complicated because the bridge must be treated as a proper layer of cells instead of being a wormhole connecting two points in the map.

If the pathfinder explicitly tracked the connections between cells then the bridges can insert connections into their own separate cell layer for pathfinding and the ActorMap.  We should be able to get away with a single layer for all high bridges - supporting multiple overlapping high bridges would add considerable extra complexity.

The low-level input code will also need to change to support this: it currently resolves the clicked cell at the Viewport level, which means we either need to teach that about high bridges (not very nice), or we move the click location -> cell resolution somewhere closer to mod code (also not very nice).

data.title: Support ground-level bridges in TS
data.body:
These are not fundamentally different to the "long bridges" in the RA mod, so it should be possible to support these after some straightforward adjustments:
- Add support for multiple / randomized template variants in the `Bridge` trait.  This will allow us compress the 28 bridge overlay types into 6 actor definitions.  It might pay to split the rendering code out into its own `WithSpriteBridgeBody` while there.
- Add support for map-placed bridges in `BridgeLayer`.

data.title: Added a unit test for MPos conversions
data.body: I was inspired by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7743#issuecomment-87038763 and astonished to hit a problem that quickly.

data.title: Fixed scientist sprite shadow on frame 25 for both Red Alert and Tiberian Dawn
data.body: Source: http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=4069.0

data.title: Fixed bright dots on TS temperate terrain water
data.body: Temperate water tiles use palette index #1, which is also used for shadow on SHPs.

data.title: Added the Nod repair bay icon
data.body: Set up Nod repair bay icon for cases where Nod captures a GDI construction yard.

data.title: Allowed WithBuildingExplosion to randomly select from multiple sequences
data.body: And used that to implement TS building explosions matching the original.

data.title: Fixed Tiberian Sun infantry crush palette
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8897.

data.title: Fixed the Lua API demanding AttackBase for AttackMove Combat properties
data.body: Since https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4464 every unit can AttackMove whether it has Attack traits or not. Our Lua API doesn't reflect hat which leads to crashes. Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8462.

data.title: Fixed a desync when a player surrenders
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8863.

data.title: Added more variation to the Tiberian Sun light infantry gun
data.body: See https://github.com/LipkeGu/TSIniFiles/blob/master/rules.ini#L7356 for reference. Hint via https://www.reddit.com/r/commandandconquer/comments/3fes7v/openra_developers_testing_the_tiberian_sun_mod_in/ctoqio4

data.title: LAN discovery
data.body:
I noticed there is no LAN discovery support. LAN parties might enjoy it more if the games could be found.

https://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/3ducd2/want_to_play_locally_with_my_father/ct8slv9

data.title: WithProductionOverlay: replace ITick => INotifyCreated & add INotifyOwnerChanged
data.body:
Allows WithProductionOverlay to update which `ProductionQueue` is associated with it, including after owner changes, based on the first enabled `ProductionQueue`.

Replaces the use of `ITick.Tick(Actor self)` with `INotifyCreated.Created(Actor self)` and `INotifyBuildComplete.BuildingComplete(Actor self)` for executing initialization code.

data.title: Suggestion: Connect the web pages
data.body:
Hey, I noticed that there are alot sub pages and they are not connected enough in my opinion.
I suggest to add a link to gamereplays.org at the resource center
and also to add the resources center at the navigation bar of the main page.

This could boost value of these sub pages.

data.title: Fix TS water effect palettes.
data.body:
Also copied over the waterpiffs from RA because TS equvivalent has no
fitting palette (the snow-only palette seems only appropriate, might be winter_piff instead of water_piff?)/only singular piff exists - w_piffs didn't.

Fixes #8898.

data.title: Makes dropdown menus auto-scroll to selected item.
data.body: Fixes #8832. This is best tested with the tile selector in Tiberian Sun map editor.

data.title: Allow text-field for maps in lobby

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
When you start a custom game, we need a text-field or text printet in chat for us to know how to set it up. Etc. ant party: how many do we need of each faction?
And text can also tell what we need to know in the map: oil in the middle, tanks hp:2000 etc..
